trigger_events: A c_n hunting patrol spots a group of Twolegs dumping a large amount of Twoleg rubbish and crowfood into the river. The water now has a bitter, metallic taste, and the cats who drink it notice their stomachs begin to hurt when they return home.

r_w stops by the river on their way back from a hunting patrol to have a drink. An awful smell stops them in their tracks, and they notice a strange mound sticking out of the water. It seems that some Twolegs have cleaned out their dirtplace into the water and contaminated it.

A regular border patrol stumbles across the large body of a moose. They're excited at first, but when they get closer, they notice that its body has begun rotting, and that half of it is laying in the river that c_n regularly drinks from. Crowfood and blood mix with the flow of the freshwater, contaminating it.

moon1: Several cats of c_n have been getting sick from their only water source, crowding the dirtplace and filling the camp with moans of pain.

Many cats of c_n have been waking up with horrible stomach pain after drinking from the murky river. The air in camp is foul and sad. No one has the energy to hunt, to train, or even to speak with each other.
c_n camp is full of cats in pain, ill from drinking the contaminated water or eating prey that did.
moon2: The cats of c_n are thirsty-- unbearably thirsty. Some cats continue to drink the contaminated water, just ending up more sick and dehydrated because of it. Patrols have attempted to fetch water from a faraway source, but the clumps of moss that they return with have nearly dripped dry by the time they get back.

The river has not cleared up. Able cats have been sent to find water elsewhere, but once another source is found, it's too far away for much water to be successfully transported. Not even eating is safe-- water-sick prey has been passing its symptoms to the cat that eats it. Cats begin to starve as well as thirst.
Sick and thirsty cats litter the clearing. When clouds pass over the sun, they open their eyes and turn to the sky, mouths open, praying for some fresh rain to drink.

The cats of c_n are getting thirsty. Responsible warriors stay on guard at night to stop their sick Clanmates from sneaking out to drink from the contaminated river, while queens shape large leaves into cups in an attempt to catch any rain that might happen to fall from the sky.

conclusion_events: Unable to stand the thirst anymore, a weak r_w stumbles to the river, knowing of the sickness that they might have to battle because of it. They take a sip, and are surprised when they taste and smell cool, fresh water. They look down through the clear river, finally able to see the pebbles on the bottom again. Rejuvenated, r_w takes a few gracious gulps before sprinting back to camp with the good news. The river is clean!

The foul scent from the river has begun to fade, until one day, it seems to be completely gone. A border patrol visits the site of the pollution, and are elated to find it completely clear! Twoleg paw prints are evident in the mud. It seems that they've finally done something right!

The Clan has been closely monitoring the state of the river. Finally, lead_name has announced that the contamination is gone, and the water is once more safe to drink. Thirsty warriors rush to the camp entrance, clearing the medicine den of their moss stores, to fetch water for the ill.

trigger_events: Greenleaf is as hot as ever, but this morning just seems unbearable. The ground is hot, the air is hot, and even the slight breeze does nothing to relieve cats from the beaming sun.

Cats are waking up in the middle of the night, complaining about the sudden unbearable heat of greenleaf. Warriors are wary and exhausted from the lack of sleep, and medicine cats are worried about herbs and heat stroke.

moon1: l_n is worried about the temperature rise and advises cats to stay within shaded areas for now until it passes. Patrols will be done earlier in the morning when it's cooler and kittens are to strictly play inside the dens to avoid the sun.

The medicine cats are rushing to preserve herbs, worried the heat would damage them before they're able to be used. A decent portion of herbs has already dried up, thankfully still usable under the right conditions but worrying nonetheless.

Cats from all roles remind each other to drink water and take breaks to avoid dehydration as the days just get hotter. Elders and kittens are watched carefully for any signs of sickness, and the medicine cats are always on edge.

conclusion_events: It's the first time in moons where cats sleep through the night without waking up from the uncomfortable heat. It is a small thing to celebrate, but at least c_n can work without exhaustion.
The ancestors answered! Clouds block the sun and the wind is cool against fur, giving well-needed relief from the days of excessive heat. Cats can play and patrol freely as they could once before.

death_text: After days of unrelenting heat and limited water, m_c's strength finally gave out.
m_c's body was unable to handle the extreme temperatures, and despite fighting to survive, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} slowly faded away.

history_text.reg_death: m_c succumbed to the unbearable heat created by a heat wave.
history_text.lead_dead: succumbed to the unbearable heat created by a heat wave.

trigger_events: As dusk falls, a distant rumbling from the sky disrupts c_n's nighttime routine. Black clouds with flashing lights cover the sky and moon, casting a blanket of cold, wet air to fall upon the Camp. Something big is coming.
Whispers of a prophecy of howling wind, shivering clouds, and a blanket of cool darkness fill the ears of c_n. Every cat is on edge as they wait anxiously on what is to come.

moon1: Rain plummets from the sky suddenly, drenching anything in its path. c_n flees to shelter as the sky roars and screams, flashing with streams of light that quake the ground. Cats huddle together away from the rain, terrified of the loud noises.

As the storm appears on the horizon, blackening the sky and sending rivers of rain, l_n orders cats to seek shelter in the dens. The thunder roars and quakes the ground as water pours into the dens, but at least cats are away from the worst of it.
c_n is startled awake as the sky roars and trembles with bright light, rain pooling into the dens with no sign of stopping.

conclusion_events: After what seemed like hours of nonstop rain, the sky parts its clouds to allow light to shine through. The storms anger is finally over.
The storm passed as quickly as it came, but it left behind a flooded Camp and broken foliage. c_n works together to restore what they can, relieved the storm didn't destroy too much in its anger.

trigger_events: The sky has brought with it swelling rivers that fight their embankments. Water flows freely without a path, and everycat has to keep their claws on the ground to keep themselves from floating away.

On a day like any other, you emerge from your den with a yawn. Just as you approach the fresh-kill pile to eat breakfast, the ground trembles underneath you. As the shaking intensifies, l_n yowls an order for everyone to take shelter.

moon1: Every morning, the cats of c_n leave their dens expecting the stability of the earth to betray them. Ever since the earthquake, everyone has been very uneasy. You can't get the sounds out of your head-- trees uprooting themselves, pebbles jumping across the clearing, kits crying as their dens violently shook. c_n, warily, has started to rebuild.

Ever since the earthquake, prey has been harder to find. It seems that no one wants to leave their dens-- not even a mouse. You can't blame them, but with the Camp crumbled and full of debris, you'd like to at least have a good meal.
It's been hard for c_n since the earthquake. Every cat is exhausted from dealing with fallen trees, broken dens, and a lack of prey.

conclusion_events: Since the earthquake, c_n has rebuilt. Warriors have put all of their time into getting dens refortified, trees hauled out of the clearing, and fresh-kill pile restocked. The ground is still underpaw, and the Camp is safe.
